required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: The Prevalence of Anxiety in Patients Undergoing Radiologic Exam

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical trial design evaluates whether hand massage reduces anxiety levels in cancer patients as they undergo radiological examination to evaluate tumor response. Anxiety levels will be investigated before massage, after massage, and following the completion of the radiological exam. The Visual Analog Scale (VAS), a validated anxiety assessment tool, will be used to measure anxiety.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Anxiety as Measured by Visual Analog Scale
primary_outcome.description: Subjects self-reported their perceived anxiety by marking a visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS covers the range 0 to 10. Higher values indicate greater anxiety (worse outcome). Analysis based on difference reported anxiety score between Baseline and after imaging.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Blood Pressure in mmHg
secondary_outcome.description: A trained clinician will measure and record the subject's blood pressure using standard practices.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Respiration Rate in Breaths Per Minute
secondary_outcome.description: A trained clinician will measure and record the subject's respiration rate using standard practices.
A trained clinician will measure and record the subject's radial pulse rate using standard practices.

arm_group.description: Subjects in this arm will complete rate their anxiety by visual analog scale (VAS). Blood pressure, pulse and respiration will be recorded before and after imaging. The anxiety VAS will be repeated after the imaging procedure. Subjects in this arm will not receive the hand massage prior to the imaging procedure.

Subjects in this arm will complete rate their anxiety by visual analog scale (VAS). Blood pressure, pulse and respiration will be recorded before massage, after massage but before imaging, and after imaging.The subjects will receive hand massage prior to the imaging procedure. The anxiety VAS will be repeated after the imaging procedure.

intervention.description: The hand massage procedure comprises 4 minutes of manipulation of the subject's hands (2 minutes per hand) by a skilled massage therapist or appropriately trained staff.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Age â‰¥ 18 years
- Scheduled to undergo radiologic imaging evaluation of a tumor
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hand injury within 30 days prior to study participation
- Known pregnancy
- Mental disability as determined by the treating physician
- Actively receiving radiation therapy
- Actively receiving chemotherapy

group.title: Hand Massage
group.description: Subjects in this arm will complete rate their anxiety by visual analog scale (VAS). Blood pressure, pulse and respiration will be recorded before massage, after massage but before imaging, and after imaging.The subjects will receive hand massage prior to the imaging procedure. The anxiety VAS will be repeated after the imaging procedure. Hand Massage: The hand massage procedure comprises 4 minutes of manipulation of the subject's hands (2 minutes per hand) by a skilled massage therapist or appropriately trained staff.

group.title: No Massage
group.description: Subjects in this arm will complete rate their anxiety by visual analog scale (VAS). Blood pressure, pulse and respiration will be recorded before and after imaging. The anxiety VAS will be repeated after the imaging procedure. Subjects in this arm will not receive the hand massage prior to the imaging procedure.

outcome.population: All patients completing the study per protocol were included in the analysis.

measure.title: Change in Anxiety as Measured by Visual Analog Scale
measure.description: Subjects self-reported their perceived anxiety by marking a visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS covers the range 0 to 10. Higher values indicate greater anxiety (worse outcome). Analysis based on difference reported anxiety score between Baseline and after imaging.
measure.population: All patients completing the study per protocol were included in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: H0: No difference in reported anxiety as self-reported change of VAS between Baseline and After Imaging time points between the Massage and No Massage groups After Imaging.
analysis.p_value_desc: No multiple comparisons were conducted in this analysis. P-value not adjusted for multiple comparisons. No interim analyses performed.

measure.title: Change in Blood Pressure in mmHg
measure.description: A trained clinician will measure and record the subject's blood pressure using standard practices.
measure.population: All patients completing the study per protocol were included in the analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: H0: No difference in reported systolic blood pressure measurements between Baseline and After Imaging time points between the Massage and No Massage groups After Imaging.
analysis.p_value_desc: No multiple comparisons were conducted in this analysis. P-value not adjusted for multiple comparisons. No interim analyses performed.

analysis.groups_desc: H0: No difference in reported diastolic blood pressure between Baseline and After Imaging time points between the Massage and No Massage groups After Imaging.
analysis.p_value_desc: No multiple comparisons were conducted in this analysis. P-Value not adjusted for multiple comparisons. No interim analyses were performed.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
